31 #define STUDIO_ENABLE_PERF_COUNTERS

33 #define STUDIO_SEQUENCE_ACTIVITY_LOOKUPS_ARE_SLOW 0
34 // If this is set to 1, then the activity->sequence mapping inside
35 // the CStudioHdr will not be initialized until the first call to
36 // SelectWeightedSequence() or HaveSequenceForActivity(). If set
37 // to zero, the mapping will be initialized from CStudioHdr::Init()
38 // (itself called from the constructor).
39 // As of June 4 2007, this was set to 1 because physics, among other
40 // systems, extemporaneously declares CStudioHdrs inside local function
41 // scopes without querying their activity/sequence mapping at all.
42 #define STUDIO_SEQUENCE_ACTIVITY_LAZY_INITIALIZE 1

373 #define BONE_CALCULATE_MASK 0x1F
374 #define BONE_PHYSICALLY_SIMULATED 0x01 // bone is physically simulated when physics are active
375 #define BONE_PHYSICS_PROCEDURAL 0x02 // procedural when physics is active
376 #define BONE_ALWAYS_PROCEDURAL 0x04 // bone is always procedurally animated
377 #define BONE_SCREEN_ALIGN_SPHERE 0x08 // bone aligns to the screen, not constrained in motion.
378 #define BONE_SCREEN_ALIGN_CYLINDER 0x10 // bone aligns to the screen, constrained by it's own axis.
379 
380 #define BONE_USED_MASK 0x0007FF00
381 #define BONE_USED_BY_ANYTHING 0x0007FF00
382 #define BONE_USED_BY_HITBOX 0x00000100 // bone (or child) is used by a hit box
383 #define BONE_USED_BY_ATTACHMENT 0x00000200 // bone (or child) is used by an attachment point
384 #define BONE_USED_BY_VERTEX_MASK 0x0003FC00
385 #define BONE_USED_BY_VERTEX_LOD0 0x00000400 // bone (or child) is used by the toplevel model via skinned vertex
386 #define BONE_USED_BY_VERTEX_LOD1 0x00000800
387 #define BONE_USED_BY_VERTEX_LOD2 0x00001000
388 #define BONE_USED_BY_VERTEX_LOD3 0x00002000
389 #define BONE_USED_BY_VERTEX_LOD4 0x00004000
390 #define BONE_USED_BY_VERTEX_LOD5 0x00008000
391 #define BONE_USED_BY_VERTEX_LOD6 0x00010000
392 #define BONE_USED_BY_VERTEX_LOD7 0x00020000
393 #define BONE_USED_BY_BONE_MERGE 0x00040000 // bone is available for bone merge to occur against it
394 
395 #define BONE_USED_BY_VERTEX_AT_LOD(lod) ( BONE_USED_BY_VERTEX_LOD0 << (lod) )
396 #define BONE_USED_BY_ANYTHING_AT_LOD(lod) ( ( BONE_USED_BY_ANYTHING & ~BONE_USED_BY_VERTEX_MASK ) | BONE_USED_BY_VERTEX_AT_LOD(lod) )
397 
398 #define MAX_NUM_LODS 8
399 
400 #define BONE_TYPE_MASK 0x00F00000
401 #define BONE_FIXED_ALIGNMENT 0x00100000 // bone can't spin 360 degrees, all interpolation is normalized around a fixed orientation
402 
403 #define BONE_HAS_SAVEFRAME_POS 0x00200000 // Vector48
404 #define BONE_HAS_SAVEFRAME_ROT 0x00400000 // Quaternion64

635 // per bone per animation DOF and weight pointers
636 struct mstudioanim_t
637 {
638  DECLARE_BYTESWAP_DATADESC();
639  byte bone;
640  byte flags; // weighing options
641 
642  // valid for animating data only
643  inline byte *pData( void ) const { return (((byte *)this) + sizeof( struct mstudioanim_t )); };
644  inline mstudioanim_valueptr_t *pRotV( void ) const { return (mstudioanim_valueptr_t *)(pData()); };
645  inline mstudioanim_valueptr_t *pPosV( void ) const { return (mstudioanim_valueptr_t *)(pData()) + ((flags & STUDIO_ANIM_ANIMROT) != 0); };
646 
647  // valid if animation unvaring over timeline
648  inline Quaternion48 *pQuat48( void ) const { return (Quaternion48 *)(pData()); };
649  inline Quaternion64 *pQuat64( void ) const { return (Quaternion64 *)(pData()); };
650  inline Vector48 *pPos( void ) const { return (Vector48 *)(pData() + ((flags & STUDIO_ANIM_RAWROT) != 0) * sizeof( *pQuat48() ) + ((flags & STUDIO_ANIM_RAWROT2) != 0) * sizeof( *pQuat64() ) ); };
651 
652  short nextoffset;
653  inline mstudioanim_t *pNext( void ) const { if (nextoffset != 0) return (mstudioanim_t *)(((byte *)this) + nextoffset); else return NULL; };
654 };

768 {
769  DECLARE_BYTESWAP_DATADESC();
770  int baseptr;

772

774  inline char * const pszLabel( void ) const { return ((char *)this) + szlabelindex; }

777  inline char * const pszActivityName( void ) const { return ((char *)this) + szactivitynameindex; }

779  int flags; // looping/non-looping flags
780 
781  int activity; // initialized at loadtime to game DLL values
782  int actweight;
783 
784  int numevents;
785  int eventindex;
786  inline mstudioevent_t *pEvent( int i ) const { Assert( i >= 0 && i < numevents); return (mstudioevent_t *)(((byte *)this) + eventindex) + i; };
787 
788  Vector bbmin; // per sequence bounding box
789  Vector bbmax;
790 
791  int numblends;
792 
793  // Index into array of shorts which is groupsize[0] x groupsize[1] in length
794  int animindexindex;
795 
796  inline int anim( int x, int y ) const
797  {
798  if ( x >= groupsize[0] )
799  {
800  x = groupsize[0] - 1;
801  }
802 
803  if ( y >= groupsize[1] )
804  {
805  y = groupsize[ 1 ] - 1;
806  }
807 
808  int offset = y * groupsize[0] + x;
809  short *blends = (short *)(((byte *)this) + animindexindex);
810  int value = (int)blends[ offset ];
811  return value;
812  }
813 
814  int movementindex; // [blend] float array for blended movement
815  int groupsize[2];
816  int paramindex[2]; // X, Y, Z, XR, YR, ZR
817  float paramstart[2]; // local (0..1) starting value
818  float paramend[2]; // local (0..1) ending value
819  int paramparent;
820 
821  float fadeintime; // ideal cross fate in time (0.2 default)
822  float fadeouttime; // ideal cross fade out time (0.2 default)
823 
824  int localentrynode; // transition node at entry
825  int localexitnode; // transition node at exit
826  int nodeflags; // transition rules
827 
828  float entryphase; // used to match entry gait
829  float exitphase; // used to match exit gait
830 
831  float lastframe; // frame that should generation EndOfSequence
832 
833  int nextseq; // auto advancing sequences
834  int pose; // index of delta animation between end and nextseq
835 
836  int numikrules;
837 
838  int numautolayers; //
839  int autolayerindex;
840  inline mstudioautolayer_t *pAutolayer( int i ) const { Assert( i >= 0 && i < numautolayers); return (mstudioautolayer_t *)(((byte *)this) + autolayerindex) + i; };
841 
842  int weightlistindex;
843  inline float *pBoneweight( int i ) const { return ((float *)(((byte *)this) + weightlistindex) + i); };
844  inline float weight( int i ) const { return *(pBoneweight( i)); };
845 
846  // FIXME: make this 2D instead of 2x1D arrays
847  int posekeyindex;
848  float *pPoseKey( int iParam, int iAnim ) const { return (float *)(((byte *)this) + posekeyindex) + iParam * groupsize[0] + iAnim; }
849  float poseKey( int iParam, int iAnim ) const { return *(pPoseKey( iParam, iAnim )); }
850 
851  int numiklocks;
852  int iklockindex;

908 enum FlexControllerRemapType_t
909 {
910  FLEXCONTROLLER_REMAP_PASSTHRU = 0,
911  FLEXCONTROLLER_REMAP_2WAY, // Control 0 -> ramps from 1-0 from 0->0.5. Control 1 -> ramps from 0-1 from 0.5->1
912  FLEXCONTROLLER_REMAP_NWAY, // StepSize = 1 / (control count-1) Control n -> ramps from 0-1-0 from (n-1)*StepSize to n*StepSize to (n+1)*StepSize. A second control is needed to specify amount to use
913  FLEXCONTROLLER_REMAP_EYELID
914 };

921  int sznameindex;

923 
924  // These are used like a union to save space
925  // Here are the possible configurations for a UI controller
926  //
927  // SIMPLE NON-STEREO: 0: control 1: unused 2: unused
928  // STEREO: 0: left 1: right 2: unused
929  // NWAY NON-STEREO: 0: control 1: unused 2: value
930  // NWAY STEREO: 0: left 1: right 2: value
931 
932  int szindex0;
933  int szindex1;
934  int szindex2;
935 
936  inline const mstudioflexcontroller_t *pController( void ) const
937  {

939  }

941  inline int controllerIndex( const CStudioHdr &cStudioHdr ) const;
942 
943  inline const mstudioflexcontroller_t *pLeftController( void ) const
944  {
945  return stereo ? (mstudioflexcontroller_t *)( (char *)this + szindex0 ) : NULL;
946  }
947  inline char * const pszLeftName( void ) const { return stereo ? pLeftController()->pszName() : NULL; }
948  inline int leftIndex( const CStudioHdr &cStudioHdr ) const;
949 
950  inline const mstudioflexcontroller_t *pRightController( void ) const
951  {
952  return stereo ? (mstudioflexcontroller_t *)( (char *)this + szindex1 ): NULL;
953  }
954  inline char * const pszRightName( void ) const { return stereo ? pRightController()->pszName() : NULL; }
955  inline int rightIndex( const CStudioHdr &cStudioHdr ) const;
956 
957  inline const mstudioflexcontroller_t *pNWayValueController( void ) const

960  }

962  inline int nWayValueIndex( const CStudioHdr &cStudioHdr ) const;
963 
964  // Number of controllers this ui description contains, 1, 2 or 3
965  inline int Count() const { return ( stereo ? 2 : 1 ) + ( remaptype == FLEXCONTROLLER_REMAP_NWAY ? 1 : 0 ); }
966  inline const mstudioflexcontroller_t *pController( int index ) const;
967

974 // this is the memory image of vertex anims (16-bit fixed point)
975 struct mstudiovertanim_t
976 {
977  DECLARE_BYTESWAP_DATADESC();
978  unsigned short index;
979  byte speed; // 255/max_length_in_flex
980  byte side; // 255/left_right
981 
982 protected:
983  // JasonM changing this type a lot, to prefer fixed point 16 bit...
984  union
985  {
986  short delta[3];
987  float16 flDelta[3];
988  };
989 
990  union
991  {
992  short ndelta[3];
993  float16 flNDelta[3];
994  };
995 
996 public:
997  inline void ConvertToFixed( float flVertAnimFixedPointScale )
998  {
999  delta[0] = flDelta[0].GetFloat() / flVertAnimFixedPointScale;
1000  delta[1] = flDelta[1].GetFloat() / flVertAnimFixedPointScale;
1001  delta[2] = flDelta[2].GetFloat() / flVertAnimFixedPointScale;
1002  ndelta[0] = flNDelta[0].GetFloat() / flVertAnimFixedPointScale;
1003  ndelta[1] = flNDelta[1].GetFloat() / flVertAnimFixedPointScale;
1004  ndelta[2] = flNDelta[2].GetFloat() / flVertAnimFixedPointScale;
1005  }
1006 
1007  inline Vector GetDeltaFixed( float flVertAnimFixedPointScale )
1008  {
1009  return Vector( delta[0] * flVertAnimFixedPointScale, delta[1] * flVertAnimFixedPointScale, delta[2] * flVertAnimFixedPointScale );
1010  }
1011  inline Vector GetNDeltaFixed( float flVertAnimFixedPointScale )
1012  {
1013  return Vector( ndelta[0] * flVertAnimFixedPointScale, ndelta[1] * flVertAnimFixedPointScale, ndelta[2] * flVertAnimFixedPointScale );
1014  }
1015  inline void GetDeltaFixed4DAligned( Vector4DAligned *vFillIn, float flVertAnimFixedPointScale )
1016  {
1017  vFillIn->Set( delta[0] * flVertAnimFixedPointScale, delta[1] * flVertAnimFixedPointScale, delta[2] * flVertAnimFixedPointScale, 0.0f );
1018  }
1019  inline void GetNDeltaFixed4DAligned( Vector4DAligned *vFillIn, float flVertAnimFixedPointScale )
1020  {
1021  vFillIn->Set( ndelta[0] * flVertAnimFixedPointScale, ndelta[1] * flVertAnimFixedPointScale, ndelta[2] * flVertAnimFixedPointScale, 0.0f );
1022  }
1023  inline Vector GetDeltaFloat()
1024  {
1025  return Vector (flDelta[0].GetFloat(), flDelta[1].GetFloat(), flDelta[2].GetFloat());
1026  }
1027  inline Vector GetNDeltaFloat()
1028  {
1029  return Vector (flNDelta[0].GetFloat(), flNDelta[1].GetFloat(), flNDelta[2].GetFloat());
1030  }
1031  inline void SetDeltaFixed( const Vector& vInput, float flVertAnimFixedPointScale )
1032  {
1033  delta[0] = vInput.x / flVertAnimFixedPointScale;
1034  delta[1] = vInput.y / flVertAnimFixedPointScale;
1035  delta[2] = vInput.z / flVertAnimFixedPointScale;
1036  }
1037  inline void SetNDeltaFixed( const Vector& vInputNormal, float flVertAnimFixedPointScale )
1038  {
1039  ndelta[0] = vInputNormal.x / flVertAnimFixedPointScale;
1040  ndelta[1] = vInputNormal.y / flVertAnimFixedPointScale;
1041  ndelta[2] = vInputNormal.z / flVertAnimFixedPointScale;
1042  }
1043 
1044  // Ick...can also force fp16 data into this structure for writing to file in legacy format...
1045  inline void SetDeltaFloat( const Vector& vInput )
1046  {
1047  flDelta[0].SetFloat( vInput.x );
1048  flDelta[1].SetFloat( vInput.y );
1049  flDelta[2].SetFloat( vInput.z );
1050  }
1051  inline void SetNDeltaFloat( const Vector& vInputNormal )
1052  {
1053  flNDelta[0].SetFloat( vInputNormal.x );
1054  flNDelta[1].SetFloat( vInputNormal.y );
1055  flNDelta[2].SetFloat( vInputNormal.z );
1056  }
1057

1064  }
1065  };

1568 struct studiohwdata_t
1569 {
1570  int m_RootLOD; // calced and clamped, nonzero for lod culling
1571  int m_NumLODs;
1572  studioloddata_t *m_pLODs;
1573  int m_NumStudioMeshes;
1574 
1575  inline float LODMetric( float unitSphereSize ) const { return ( unitSphereSize != 0.0f ) ? (100.0f / unitSphereSize) : 0.0f; }
1576  inline int GetLODForMetric( float lodMetric ) const
1577  {
1578  if ( !m_NumLODs )
1579  return 0;
1580 
1581  // shadow lod is specified on the last lod with a negative switch
1582  // never consider shadow lod as viable candidate
1583  int numLODs = (m_pLODs[m_NumLODs-1].m_SwitchPoint < 0.0f) ? m_NumLODs-1 : m_NumLODs;
1584 
1585  for ( int i = m_RootLOD; i < numLODs-1; i++ )
1586  {
1587  if ( m_pLODs[i+1].m_SwitchPoint > lodMetric )
1588  return i;
1589  }
1590 
1591  return numLODs-1;
1592  }
1593 };

1712  virtualgroup_t *pAnimGroup( int animation ) { return &m_group[ m_anim[ animation ].group ]; } // Note: user must manage mutex for this
1713  virtualgroup_t *pSeqGroup( int sequence )
1714  {
1715  // Check for out of range access that is causing crashes on some servers.
1716  // Perhaps caused by sourcemod bugs. Typical sequence in these cases is ~292
1717  // when the count is 234. Using unsigned math allows for free range
1718  // checking against zero.
1719  if ( (unsigned)sequence >= (unsigned)m_seq.Count() )
1720  {
1721  Assert( 0 );
1722  return 0;
1723  }
1724  return &m_group[ m_seq[ sequence ].group ];
1725  } // Note: user must manage mutex for this
1726

1739 // 'thin' vertex data, used to do model decals (see Studio_CreateThinVertexes())
1740 struct thinModelVertices_t
1741 {
1742  void Init( int numBoneInfluences, Vector *positions, unsigned short *normals, float *boneWeights, char *boneIndices )
1743  {
1744  Assert( positions != NULL );
1745  Assert( normals != NULL );
1746  Assert( ( numBoneInfluences >= 0 ) && ( numBoneInfluences <= 3 ) );
1747  Assert( numBoneInfluences > 0 ? !!boneIndices : !boneIndices );
1748  Assert( numBoneInfluences > 1 ? !!boneWeights : !boneWeights );
1749  m_numBoneInfluences = numBoneInfluences;
1750  m_vecPositions = positions;
1751  m_vecNormals = normals;
1752  m_boneWeights = boneWeights;
1753  m_boneIndices = boneIndices;
1754  }
1755 
1756  void SetPosition( int vertIndex, const Vector & position )
1757  {
1758  Assert( m_vecPositions );
1759  m_vecPositions[ vertIndex ] = position;
1760  }
1761 
1762  void SetNormal( int vertIndex, const Vector & normal )
1763  {
1764  Assert( m_vecNormals );
1765  unsigned int packedNormal;
1766  PackNormal_UBYTE4( normal.x, normal.y, normal.z, &packedNormal );
1767  m_vecNormals[ vertIndex ] = (unsigned short)( 0x0000FFFF & packedNormal );
1768  }
1769 
1770  void SetBoneWeights( int vertIndex, const mstudioboneweight_t & boneWeights )
1771  {
1772  Assert( ( m_numBoneInfluences >= 1 ) && ( m_numBoneInfluences <= 3 ) );
1773  Assert( ( boneWeights.numbones >= 1 ) && ( boneWeights.numbones <= m_numBoneInfluences ) );
1774  int numStoredWeights = max( 0, ( m_numBoneInfluences - 1 ) );
1775  float *pBaseWeight = m_boneWeights + vertIndex*numStoredWeights;
1776  char *pBaseIndex = m_boneIndices + vertIndex*m_numBoneInfluences;
1777  for ( int i = 0; i < m_numBoneInfluences; i++ )
1778  {
1779  pBaseIndex[i] = boneWeights.bone[i];
1780  }
1781  for ( int i = 0; i < numStoredWeights; i++ )
1782  {
1783  pBaseWeight[i] = boneWeights.weight[i];
1784  }
1785  }
1786 
1787  void GetMeshPosition( mstudiomesh_t *pMesh, int meshIndex, Vector *pPosition ) const
1788  {
1789  Assert( pMesh );
1790  GetPosition( pMesh->vertexdata.GetGlobalVertexIndex( meshIndex ), pPosition );
1791  }
1792 
1793  void GetMeshNormal( mstudiomesh_t *pMesh, int meshIndex, Vector *pNormal ) const
1794  {
1795  Assert( pMesh );
1796  GetNormal( pMesh->vertexdata.GetGlobalVertexIndex( meshIndex ), pNormal );
1797  }
1798 
1799  void GetMeshBoneWeights( mstudiomesh_t *pMesh, int meshIndex, mstudioboneweight_t *pBoneWeights ) const
1800  {
1801  Assert( pMesh );
1802  GetBoneWeights( pMesh->vertexdata.GetGlobalVertexIndex( meshIndex ), pBoneWeights );
1803  }
1804 
1805  void GetModelPosition( mstudiomodel_t *pModel, int modelIndex, Vector *pPosition ) const
1806  {
1807  Assert( pModel );
1808  GetPosition( pModel->vertexdata.GetGlobalVertexIndex( modelIndex ), pPosition );
1809  }
1810 
1811  void GetModelNormal( mstudiomodel_t *pModel, int modelIndex, Vector *pNormal ) const

1813  Assert( pModel );

1816 
1817  void GetModelBoneWeights( mstudiomodel_t *pModel, int modelIndex, mstudioboneweight_t *pBoneWeights ) const
1818  {
1819  Assert( pModel );
1820  GetBoneWeights( pModel->vertexdata.GetGlobalVertexIndex( modelIndex ), pBoneWeights );
1821  }
1822 
1823 private:
1824  void GetPosition( int vertIndex, Vector *pPosition ) const
1825  {
1826  Assert( pPosition );
1827  Assert( m_vecPositions );
1828  *pPosition = m_vecPositions[ vertIndex ];
1829  }
1830 
1831  void GetNormal( int vertIndex, Vector *pNormal ) const
1832  {
1833  Assert( pNormal );
1834  Assert( m_vecNormals );
1835  unsigned int packedNormal = 0x0000FFFF & m_vecNormals[ vertIndex ];
1836  UnpackNormal_UBYTE4( &packedNormal, pNormal->Base() );
1837  }
1838 
1839  void GetBoneWeights( int vertIndex, mstudioboneweight_t *pBoneWeights ) const
1840  {
1841  Assert( pBoneWeights );
1842  Assert( ( m_numBoneInfluences <= 1 ) || ( m_boneWeights != NULL ) );
1843  Assert( ( m_numBoneInfluences <= 0 ) || ( m_boneIndices != NULL ) );
1844  int numStoredWeights = max( 0, ( m_numBoneInfluences - 1 ) );
1845  float *pBaseWeight = m_boneWeights + vertIndex*numStoredWeights;
1846  char *pBaseIndex = m_boneIndices + vertIndex*m_numBoneInfluences;
1847  float sum = 0.0f;
1848  for (int i = 0;i < MAX_NUM_BONES_PER_VERT;i++)
1849  {
1850  if ( i < ( m_numBoneInfluences - 1 ) )
1851  pBoneWeights->weight[i] = pBaseWeight[i];
1852  else
1853  pBoneWeights->weight[i] = 1.0f - sum;
1854  sum += pBoneWeights->weight[i];
1855 
1856  pBoneWeights->bone[i] = ( i < m_numBoneInfluences ) ? pBaseIndex[i] : 0;
1857  }
1858 
1859  // Treat 'zero weights' as '100% binding to bone zero':
1860  pBoneWeights->numbones = m_numBoneInfluences ? m_numBoneInfluences : 1;
1861  }
1862 
1863  int m_numBoneInfluences;// Number of bone influences per vertex, N
1864  float *m_boneWeights; // This array stores (N-1) weights per vertex (unless N is zero)
1865  char *m_boneIndices; // This array stores N indices per vertex
1866  Vector *m_vecPositions;
1867  unsigned short *m_vecNormals; // Normals are compressed into 16 bits apiece (see PackNormal_UBYTE4() )
1868 };
1869 
1870 // ----------------------------------------------------------
1871 // Studio Model Vertex Data File
1872 // Position independent flat data for cache manager
1873 // ----------------------------------------------------------
1874 
1875 // little-endian "IDSV"
1876 #define MODEL_VERTEX_FILE_ID (('V'<<24)+('S'<<16)+('D'<<8)+'I')
1877 #define MODEL_VERTEX_FILE_VERSION 4
1878 // this id (IDCV) is used once the vertex data has been compressed (see CMDLCache::CreateThinVertexes)
1879 #define MODEL_VERTEX_FILE_THIN_ID (('V'<<24)+('C'<<16)+('D'<<8)+'I')
1880 
1881 struct vertexFileHeader_t
1882 {
1883  DECLARE_BYTESWAP_DATADESC();
1884  int id; // MODEL_VERTEX_FILE_ID
1885  int version; // MODEL_VERTEX_FILE_VERSION
1886  int checksum; // same as studiohdr_t, ensures sync
1887  int numLODs; // num of valid lods
1888  int numLODVertexes[MAX_NUM_LODS]; // num verts for desired root lod
1889  int numFixups; // num of vertexFileFixup_t
1890  int fixupTableStart; // offset from base to fixup table
1891  int vertexDataStart; // offset from base to vertex block
1892  int tangentDataStart; // offset from base to tangent block
1893 
1894 public:
1895 
1896  // Accessor to fat vertex data
1897  const mstudiovertex_t *GetVertexData() const
1898  {
1899  if ( ( id == MODEL_VERTEX_FILE_ID ) && ( vertexDataStart != 0 ) )
1900  return ( mstudiovertex_t * ) ( vertexDataStart + (byte *)this );
1901  else
1902  return NULL;
1903  }
1904  // Accessor to (fat) tangent vertex data (tangents aren't stored in compressed data)
1905  const Vector4D *GetTangentData() const
1906  {
1907  if ( ( id == MODEL_VERTEX_FILE_ID ) && ( tangentDataStart != 0 ) )
1908  return ( Vector4D * ) ( tangentDataStart + (byte *)this );
1909  else
1910  return NULL;
1911  }
1912  // Accessor to thin vertex data
1913  const thinModelVertices_t *GetThinVertexData() const
1914  {
1915  if ( ( id == MODEL_VERTEX_FILE_THIN_ID ) && ( vertexDataStart != 0 ) )
1916  return ( thinModelVertices_t * ) ( vertexDataStart + (byte *)this );
1917  else
1918  return NULL;
1919  }
1920 };
1921 
1922 // model vertex data accessor (defined here so vertexFileHeader_t can be used)
1923 inline const mstudio_modelvertexdata_t * mstudiomodel_t::GetVertexData( void *pModelData )
1924 {
1925  const vertexFileHeader_t * pVertexHdr = CacheVertexData( pModelData );
1926  if ( !pVertexHdr )
1927  {
1928  vertexdata.pVertexData = NULL;
1929  vertexdata.pTangentData = NULL;
1930  return NULL;
1931  }
1932 
1933  vertexdata.pVertexData = pVertexHdr->GetVertexData();
1934  vertexdata.pTangentData = pVertexHdr->GetTangentData();
1935 
1936  if ( !vertexdata.pVertexData )
1937  return NULL;
1938 
1939  return &vertexdata;
1940 }
1941 
1942 // model thin vertex data accessor (defined here so vertexFileHeader_t can be used)
1943 inline const thinModelVertices_t * mstudiomodel_t::GetThinVertexData( void *pModelData )
1944 {
1945  const vertexFileHeader_t * pVertexHdr = CacheVertexData( pModelData );
1946  if ( !pVertexHdr )
1947  return NULL;
1948 
1949  return pVertexHdr->GetThinVertexData();
1950 }

1956  int lod; // used to skip culled root lod
1957  int sourceVertexID; // absolute index from start of vertex/tangent blocks
1958  int numVertexes;
1959 };

1961 // This flag is set if no hitbox information was specified
1962 #define STUDIOHDR_FLAGS_AUTOGENERATED_HITBOX 0x00000001
1963 
1964 // NOTE: This flag is set at loadtime, not mdl build time so that we don't have to rebuild
1965 // models when we change materials.
1966 #define STUDIOHDR_FLAGS_USES_ENV_CUBEMAP 0x00000002
1967

1969 #define STUDIOHDR_FLAGS_FORCE_OPAQUE 0x00000004
1970 
1971 // Use this when we want to render the opaque parts during the opaque pass
1972 // and the translucent parts during the translucent pass
1973 #define STUDIOHDR_FLAGS_TRANSLUCENT_TWOPASS 0x00000008
1974 
1975 // This is set any time the .qc files has $staticprop in it
1976 // Means there's no bones and no transforms
1977 #define STUDIOHDR_FLAGS_STATIC_PROP 0x00000010
1978

1980 // models when we change materials.
1981 #define STUDIOHDR_FLAGS_USES_FB_TEXTURE 0x00000020
1982

1984 // for the .mdl (the shadow lod is the last entry in the lod list if present)
1985 #define STUDIOHDR_FLAGS_HASSHADOWLOD 0x00000040
1986

1988 // models when we change materials.

1990

1994 
1995 // NOTE: This flag is set when we should use the actual materials on the shadow LOD

2006

2509  // This class maps an activity to sequences allowed for that activity, accelerating the resolution
2510  // of SelectWeightedSequence(), especially on PowerPC. Iterating through every sequence
2511  // attached to a model turned out to be a very destructive cache access pattern on 360.
2512  //
2513  // I've encapsulated this behavior inside a nested class for organizational reasons; there is
2514  // no particular programmatic or efficiency benefit to it. It just makes clearer what particular
2515  // code in the otherwise very complicated StudioHdr class has to do with this particular
2516  // optimization, and it lets you collapse the whole definition down to a single line in Visual
2517  // Studio.
2518  class CActivityToSequenceMapping /* final */
2519  {
2520  public:
2521  // A tuple of a sequence and its corresponding weight. Lists of these correspond to activities.
2522  struct SequenceTuple
2523  {
2524  short seqnum;
2525  short weight; // the absolute value of the weight from the sequence header
2526  CUtlSymbol *pActivityModifiers; // list of activity modifier symbols
2527  int iNumActivityModifiers;
2528  };
2529 
2530  // The type of the hash's stored data, a composite of both key and value
2531  // (because that's how CUtlHash works):
2532  // key: an int, the activity #
2533  // values: an index into the m_pSequenceTuples array, a count of the
2534  // total sequences present for an activity, and the sum of their
2535  // weights.
2536  // Note this struct is 128-bits wide, exactly coincident to a PowerPC
2537  // cache line and VMX register. Please consider very carefully the
2538  // performance implications before adding any additional fields to this.
2539  // You could probably do away with totalWeight if you really had to.
2540  struct HashValueType
2541  {
2542  // KEY (hashed)
2543  int activityIdx;
2544 
2545  // VALUE (not hashed)
2546  int startingIdx;
2547  int count;
2548  int totalWeight;
2549 
2550  HashValueType(int _actIdx, int _stIdx, int _ct, int _tW) :
2551  activityIdx(_actIdx), startingIdx(_stIdx), count(_ct), totalWeight(_tW) {}
2552 
2553  // default constructor (ought not to be actually used)
2554  HashValueType() : activityIdx(-1), startingIdx(-1), count(-1), totalWeight(-1)
2555  { AssertMsg(false, "Don't use default HashValueType()!"); }
2556 
2557 
2558  class HashFuncs
2559  {
2560  public:
2561  // dummy constructor (gndn)
2562  HashFuncs( int ) {}
2563 
2564  // COMPARE
2565  // compare two entries for uniqueness. We should never have two different
2566  // entries for the same activity, so we only compare the activity index;
2567  // this allows us to use the utlhash as a dict by constructing dummy entries
2568  // as hash lookup keys.
2569  bool operator()( const HashValueType &lhs, const HashValueType &rhs ) const
2570  {
2571  return lhs.activityIdx == rhs.activityIdx;
2572  }
2573 
2574  // HASH
2575  // We only hash on the activity index; everything else is data.
2576  unsigned int operator()( const HashValueType &item ) const
2577  {
2578  return HashInt( item.activityIdx );
2579  }
2580  };
2581  };
2582 
2583  typedef CUtlHash<HashValueType, HashValueType::HashFuncs, HashValueType::HashFuncs> ActivityToValueIdxHash;
2584 
2585  // These must be here because IFM does not compile/link studio.cpp (?!?)
2586 
2587  // ctor
2588  CActivityToSequenceMapping( void )
2589  : m_pSequenceTuples(NULL), m_iSequenceTuplesCount(0), m_ActToSeqHash(8,0,0), m_expectedPStudioHdr(NULL), m_expectedVModel(NULL)
2590 #if STUDIO_SEQUENCE_ACTIVITY_LAZY_INITIALIZE
2591  , m_bIsInitialized(false)
2592 #endif
2593  {};
2594 
2595  // dtor -- not virtual because this class has no inheritors
2596  ~CActivityToSequenceMapping()
2597  {
2598  if ( m_pSequenceTuples != NULL )
2599  {
2600  if ( m_pSequenceTuples->pActivityModifiers != NULL )
2601  {
2602  delete[] m_pSequenceTuples->pActivityModifiers;
2603  }
2604  delete[] m_pSequenceTuples;
2605  }
2606  }

2648  // CStudioHdr * const m_pOuter;
2649

2658  bool ValidateAgainst( const CStudioHdr * RESTRICT pstudiohdr );

2765 struct flexsetting_t
2766 {
2767  DECLARE_BYTESWAP_DATADESC();
2768  int nameindex;
2769 
2770  inline char *pszName( void ) const
2771  {
2772  return (char *)(((byte *)this) + nameindex);
2773  }
2774 
2775  // Leaving this for legacy support
2776  int obsolete1;
2777 
2778  // Number of flex settings
2779  int numsettings;
2780  int index;
2781 
2782  // OBSOLETE:
2783  int obsolete2;
2784 
2785  // Index of start of contiguous array of flexweight_t structures
2786  int settingindex;
2787 
2788  //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2789  // Purpose: Retrieves a pointer to the flexweight_t, including resolving
2790  // any markov chain hierarchy. Because of this possibility, we return
2791  // the number of settings in the weights array returned. We'll generally
2792  // call this function with i == 0
2793  // Input : *base -
2794  // i -
2795  // **weights -
2796  // Output : int
2797  //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2798  inline int psetting( byte *base, int i, flexweight_t **weights ) const;
2799 };

2802 struct flexsettinghdr_t
2803 {
2804  DECLARE_BYTESWAP_DATADESC();
2805  int id;
2806  int version;
2807 
2808  inline const char * pszName( void ) const { return name; }
2809  char name[64];

2811 
2812  int numflexsettings;
2813  int flexsettingindex;
2814  inline flexsetting_t *pSetting( int i ) const { return (flexsetting_t *)(((byte *)this) + flexsettingindex) + i; };
2815  int nameindex;
2816 
2817  // look up flex settings by "index"
2818  int numindexes;
2819  int indexindex;
2820 
2821  inline flexsetting_t *pIndexedSetting( int index ) const
2822  {
2823  if ( index < 0 || index >= numindexes )
2824  {
2825  return NULL;
2826  }
2827 
2828  int i = *((int *)(((byte *)this) + indexindex) + index);
2829 
2830  if (i == -1)
2831  {
2832  return NULL;
2833  }
2834 
2835  return pSetting( i );
2836  }
2837 
2838  // index names of "flexcontrollers"
2839  int numkeys;
2840  int keynameindex;
2841  inline char *pLocalName( int i ) const { return (char *)(((byte *)this) + *((int *)(((byte *)this) + keynameindex) + i)); };
2842 
2843  int keymappingindex;
2844  inline int *pLocalToGlobal( int i ) const { return (int *)(((byte *)this) + keymappingindex) + i; };
2845  inline int LocalToGlobal( int i ) const { return *pLocalToGlobal( i ); };
2846 };

2848 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2849 // Purpose: Retrieves a pointer to the flexweight_t.
2850 // Input : *base - flexsettinghdr_t * pointer
2851 // i - index of flex setting to retrieve
2852 // **weights - destination for weights array starting at index i.
2853 // Output : int
2854 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2855 inline int flexsetting_t::psetting( byte *base, int i, flexweight_t **weights ) const
2856 {
2857  // Grab array pointer
2858  *weights = (flexweight_t *)(((byte *)this) + settingindex) + i;
2859  // Return true number of settings
2860  return numsettings;
2861 };

2864 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2865 // For a given flex controller ui struct, these return the index of the
2866 // studiohdr_t flex controller that correspond to the the left and right
2867 // flex controllers if the ui controller is a stereo control.
2868 // nWayValueIndex returns the index of the flex controller that is the value
2869 // flex controller for an NWAY combination
2870 // If these functions are called and the ui controller isn't of the type
2871 // specified then -1 is returned
2872 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2873 inline int mstudioflexcontrollerui_t::controllerIndex( const CStudioHdr &cStudioHdr ) const
2874 {
2875  return !stereo ? pController() - cStudioHdr.pFlexcontroller( (LocalFlexController_t)0 ) : -1;
2876 }
2877 
2878 
2879 inline int mstudioflexcontrollerui_t::rightIndex( const CStudioHdr &cStudioHdr ) const
2880 {
2881  return stereo ? pRightController() - cStudioHdr.pFlexcontroller( (LocalFlexController_t)0 ) : -1;
2882 }
2883 
2884 
2885 inline int mstudioflexcontrollerui_t::leftIndex( const CStudioHdr &cStudioHdr ) const
2886 {
2887  return stereo ? pLeftController() - cStudioHdr.pFlexcontroller((LocalFlexController_t) 0 ) : -1;
2888 }
2889 
2890 
2891 inline int mstudioflexcontrollerui_t::nWayValueIndex( const CStudioHdr &cStudioHdr ) const
2892 {
2893  return remaptype == FLEXCONTROLLER_REMAP_NWAY ? pNWayValueController() - cStudioHdr.pFlexcontroller( (LocalFlexController_t)0 ) : -1;
2894 }
2895 
2896 
2897 inline const mstudioflexcontroller_t *mstudioflexcontrollerui_t::pController( int index ) const
2898 {
2899  if ( index < 0 || index > Count() )
2900  return NULL;
2901 
2902  if ( remaptype == FLEXCONTROLLER_REMAP_NWAY )
2903  {
2904  if ( stereo )
2905  return (mstudioflexcontroller_t *)( ( char * ) this ) + *( &szindex0 + index );
2906 
2907  if ( index == 0 )
2908  return pController();
2909 
2910  if ( index == 1 )
2911  return pNWayValueController();
2912 
2913  return NULL;
2914  }
2915 
2916  if ( index > 1 )
2917  return NULL;
2918 
2919  if ( stereo )
2920  return (mstudioflexcontroller_t *)( ( char * ) this ) + *( &szindex0 + index );
2921 
2922  if ( index > 0 )
2923  return NULL;
2924 
2925  return pController();
2926 }

3005 // Insert this code anywhere that you need to allow for conversion from an old STUDIO_VERSION
3006 // to a new one.
3007 // If we only support the current version, this function should be empty.
3008 inline bool Studio_ConvertStudioHdrToNewVersion( studiohdr_t *pStudioHdr )
3009 {
3010  COMPILE_TIME_ASSERT( STUDIO_VERSION == 48 ); // put this to make sure this code is updated upon changing version.
3011 
3012  int version = pStudioHdr->version;
3013  if ( version == STUDIO_VERSION )
3014  return true;
3015 
3016  bool bResult = true;
3017  if (version < 46)
3018  {
3019  // some of the anim index data is incompatible
3020  for (int i = 0; i < pStudioHdr->numlocalanim; i++)
3021  {
3022  mstudioanimdesc_t *pAnim = (mstudioanimdesc_t *)pStudioHdr->pLocalAnimdesc( i );
3023 
3024  // old ANI files that used sections (v45 only) are not compatible
3025  if ( pAnim->sectionframes != 0 )
3026  {
3027  // zero most everything out
3028  memset( &(pAnim->numframes), 0, (byte *)(pAnim + 1) - (byte *)&(pAnim->numframes) );
3029 
3030  pAnim->numframes = 1;
3031  pAnim->animblock = -1; // disable animation fetching
3032  bResult = false;
3033  }
3034  }
3035  }
3036 
3037  if (version < 47)
3038  {
3039  // used to contain zeroframe cache data
3040  if (pStudioHdr->unused4 != 0)
3041  {
3042  pStudioHdr->unused4 = 0;
3043  bResult = false;
3044  }
3045  for (int i = 0; i < pStudioHdr->numlocalanim; i++)
3046  {
3047  mstudioanimdesc_t *pAnim = (mstudioanimdesc_t *)pStudioHdr->pLocalAnimdesc( i );
3048  pAnim->zeroframeindex = 0;
3049  pAnim->zeroframespan = 0;
3050  }
3051  }
3052  else if (version == 47)
3053  {
3054  for (int i = 0; i < pStudioHdr->numlocalanim; i++)
3055  {
3056  mstudioanimdesc_t *pAnim = (mstudioanimdesc_t *)pStudioHdr->pLocalAnimdesc( i );
3057  if (pAnim->zeroframeindex != 0)
3058  {
3059  pAnim->zeroframeindex = 0;
3060  pAnim->zeroframespan = 0;
3061  bResult = false;
3062  }
3063  }
3064  }
3065 
3066  // for now, just slam the version number since they're compatible
3067  pStudioHdr->version = STUDIO_VERSION;
3068 
3069  return bResult;
3070 }
3071 
3072 // must be run to fixup with specified rootLOD
3073 inline void Studio_SetRootLOD( studiohdr_t *pStudioHdr, int rootLOD )
3074 {
3075  // honor studiohdr restriction of root lod in case requested root lod exceeds restriction.
3076  if ( pStudioHdr->numAllowedRootLODs > 0 &&
3077  rootLOD >= pStudioHdr->numAllowedRootLODs )
3078  {
3079  rootLOD = pStudioHdr->numAllowedRootLODs - 1;
3080  }
3081 
3082  Assert( rootLOD >= 0 && rootLOD < MAX_NUM_LODS );
3083  Clamp( rootLOD, 0, MAX_NUM_LODS - 1 );
3084 
3085  // run the lod fixups that culls higher detail lods
3086  // vertexes are external, fixups ensure relative offsets and counts are cognizant of shrinking data
3087  // indexes are built in lodN..lod0 order so higher detail lod data can be truncated at load
3088  // the fixup lookup arrays are filled (or replicated) to ensure all slots valid
3089  int vertexindex = 0;
3090  int tangentsindex = 0;
3091  int bodyPartID;
3092  for ( bodyPartID = 0; bodyPartID < pStudioHdr->numbodyparts; bodyPartID++ )
3093  {
3094  mstudiobodyparts_t *pBodyPart = pStudioHdr->pBodypart( bodyPartID );
3095  int modelID;
3096  for ( modelID = 0; modelID < pBodyPart->nummodels; modelID++ )
3097  {
3098  mstudiomodel_t *pModel = pBodyPart->pModel( modelID );
3099  int totalMeshVertexes = 0;
3100  int meshID;
3101  for ( meshID = 0; meshID < pModel->nummeshes; meshID++ )
3102  {
3103  mstudiomesh_t *pMesh = pModel->pMesh( meshID );
3104 
3105  // get the fixup, vertexes are reduced
3106  pMesh->numvertices = pMesh->vertexdata.numLODVertexes[rootLOD];
3107  pMesh->vertexoffset = totalMeshVertexes;
3108  totalMeshVertexes += pMesh->numvertices;
3109  }
3110 
3111  // stay in sync
3112  pModel->numvertices = totalMeshVertexes;
3113  pModel->vertexindex = vertexindex;
3114  pModel->tangentsindex = tangentsindex;
3115 
3116  vertexindex += totalMeshVertexes*sizeof(mstudiovertex_t);
3117  tangentsindex += totalMeshVertexes*sizeof(Vector4D);
3118  }
3119  }
3120 
3121  // track the set desired configuration
3122  pStudioHdr->rootLOD = rootLOD;
3123 }
3124 
3125 // Determines allocation requirements for vertexes
3126 inline int Studio_VertexDataSize( const vertexFileHeader_t *pVvdHdr, int rootLOD, bool bNeedsTangentS )
3127 {
3128  // the quantity of vertexes necessary for root lod and all lower detail lods
3129  // add one extra vertex to each section
3130  // the extra vertex allows prefetch hints to read ahead 1 vertex without faulting
3131  int numVertexes = pVvdHdr->numLODVertexes[rootLOD] + 1;
3132  int dataLength = pVvdHdr->vertexDataStart + numVertexes*sizeof(mstudiovertex_t);
3133  if (bNeedsTangentS)
3134  {
3135  dataLength += numVertexes*sizeof(Vector4D);
3136  }
3137 
3138  // allocate this much
3139  return dataLength;
3140 }
3141 
3142 // Load the minimum quantity of verts and run fixups
3143 inline int Studio_LoadVertexes( const vertexFileHeader_t *pTempVvdHdr, vertexFileHeader_t *pNewVvdHdr, int rootLOD, bool bNeedsTangentS )
3144 {
3145  int i;
3146  int target;
3147  int numVertexes;
3148  vertexFileFixup_t *pFixupTable;
3149 
3150  numVertexes = pTempVvdHdr->numLODVertexes[rootLOD];
3151 
3152  // copy all data up to start of vertexes
3153  memcpy((void*)pNewVvdHdr, (void*)pTempVvdHdr, pTempVvdHdr->vertexDataStart);
3154 
3155  for ( i = 0; i < rootLOD; i++)
3156  {
3157  pNewVvdHdr->numLODVertexes[i] = pNewVvdHdr->numLODVertexes[rootLOD];
3158  }
3159 
3160  // fixup data starts
3161  if (bNeedsTangentS)
3162  {
3163  // tangent data follows possibly reduced vertex data
3164  pNewVvdHdr->tangentDataStart = pNewVvdHdr->vertexDataStart + numVertexes*sizeof(mstudiovertex_t);
3165  }
3166  else
3167  {
3168  // no tangent data will be available, mark for identification
3169  pNewVvdHdr->tangentDataStart = 0;
3170  }
3171 
3172  if (!pNewVvdHdr->numFixups)
3173  {
3174  // fixups not required
3175  // transfer vertex data
3176  memcpy(
3177  (byte *)pNewVvdHdr+pNewVvdHdr->vertexDataStart,
3178  (byte *)pTempVvdHdr+pTempVvdHdr->vertexDataStart,
3179  numVertexes*sizeof(mstudiovertex_t) );
3180 
3181  if (bNeedsTangentS)
3182  {
3183  // transfer tangent data to cache memory
3184  memcpy(
3185  (byte *)pNewVvdHdr+pNewVvdHdr->tangentDataStart,
3186  (byte *)pTempVvdHdr+pTempVvdHdr->tangentDataStart,
3187  numVertexes*sizeof(Vector4D) );
3188  }
3189 
3190  return numVertexes;
3191  }
3192 
3193  // fixups required
3194  // re-establish mesh ordered vertexes into cache memory, according to table
3195  target = 0;
3196  pFixupTable = (vertexFileFixup_t *)((byte *)pTempVvdHdr + pTempVvdHdr->fixupTableStart);
3197  for (i=0; i<pTempVvdHdr->numFixups; i++)
3198  {
3199  if (pFixupTable[i].lod < rootLOD)
3200  {
3201  // working bottom up, skip over copying higher detail lods
3202  continue;
3203  }
3204 
3205  // copy vertexes
3206  memcpy(
3207  (mstudiovertex_t *)((byte *)pNewVvdHdr+pNewVvdHdr->vertexDataStart) + target,
3208  (mstudiovertex_t *)((byte *)pTempVvdHdr+pTempVvdHdr->vertexDataStart) + pFixupTable[i].sourceVertexID,
3209  pFixupTable[i].numVertexes*sizeof(mstudiovertex_t) );
3210 
3211  if (bNeedsTangentS)
3212  {
3213  // copy tangents
3214  memcpy(
3215  (Vector4D *)((byte *)pNewVvdHdr+pNewVvdHdr->tangentDataStart) + target,
3216  (Vector4D *)((byte *)pTempVvdHdr+pTempVvdHdr->tangentDataStart) + pFixupTable[i].sourceVertexID,
3217  pFixupTable[i].numVertexes*sizeof(Vector4D) );
3218  }
3219 
3220  // data is placed consecutively
3221  target += pFixupTable[i].numVertexes;
3222  }
3223 
3224  pNewVvdHdr->numFixups = 0;
3225 
3226  return target;
3227 }
